properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 19 at 11:36PM EST until February 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Flood Watch...

.Saturated soil and some lowland flooding has occurred.
Additional rainfall of 1.5 to 2 inches is forecast today.
Localized higher amounts may occur leading to more serious
flooding. Significant rain will end this evening, but
flooding issues may continue.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of east central Georgia, including
the following area, Burke.

* Through late Thursday night.

* Moderate to occasionally heavy rain is forecast for Thursday.
General rain totals of 1.5 to 2 inches are forecast. Locally
higher amounts may occur leading to more serious flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

Do not drive on flooded roads. It takes little water to move
a vehicle off the road and into deeper water. Also, the
road bed may not be intact under flood waters.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
